stimulusHtml:
• The angle in standard position is labeled theta.
  • The initial ray is on the positive x axis, and the terminal ray passes through a point on the circle in the second quadrant labeled P.

 

​The figure shows a terminal ray of an angle of measure θ{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} in standard position intersecting the unit circle at point P{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} in the xy{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}-plane. As θ{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} increases from 0{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} to 2π{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}, which of the following gives the graph of the displacement of P{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} from the x{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}-axis as a function of θ{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} ?
choicesHtml:
• All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:
  • The curve begins at point (0 comma 0).
  • The curve trends up gradually to reach a maximum point at (pi over 2 comma 1).
  • At point (pi over 2 comma 1), the curve trends down gradually, through the x axis at (pi comma 0), and reaches a minimum point at (3 pi over 2 comma negative 1).
  • At point (3 pi over 2 comma negative 1), the curve trends up gradually to the right and ends at point (2 pi comma 0).

​

• All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:
  • The curve begins at point (1 comma 0).
  • The curve trends down gradually, through the x axis at (pi over 2 comma 0) to reach a minimum point at (pi comma negative 1).
  • At point (pi comma negative 1), the curve trends up gradually, through the x axis at (3 pi over 2 comma 0), and reaches a maximum point at (2 pi comma 1).

​​

  • All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:
  • The curve begins at point (0 comma 0).
  • The curve trends down gradually to reach a minimum point at (pi over 2 comma negative 1).
  • At point (pi over 2 comma negative 1), the curve trends up gradually, through the x axis at (pi comma 0), and reaches a maximum point at (3 pi over 2 comma 1).
  • At point (3 pi over 2 comma 1), the curve trends down gradually to the right and ends at point (2 pi comma 0).

• All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:
  • The curve begins at point (negative 1 comma 0).
  • The curve trends up gradually, through the x axis at (pi over 2 comma 0) to reach a maximum point at (pi comma 1).
  • At point (pi comma 1), the curve trends down gradually, through the x axis at (3 pi over 2 comma 0), and reaches a minimum point at (2 pi comma negative 1).
